refnamediv.refpurpose: sum (row sum, column sum) of vector/matrix entries

refsynopsisdiv.title: Calling Sequence
refsynopsisdiv.synopsis:
y=sum(x) y=sum(x,'r') or y=sum(x,1)
y=sum(x,'c') or y=sum(x,2)
y=sum(x,'m')

listitem.para: vector or matrix (real, complex, sparse or polynomial)

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: For a vector or a matrix x, y=sum(x) returns in the scalar y the sum of all the entries of x.
y=sum(x,'r') (or, equivalently, y=sum(x,1)) is the rowwise sum: y(j)= sum(x(:,j)). y is a row vector
y=sum(x,'c') (or, equivalently, y=sum(x,2)) is the columnwise sum. It returns in each entry of the column vector y the sum : y(i)= sum(x(i,:)))).
y=sum(x,'m') is the sum along the first non singleton dimension of x (for compatibility with Matlab).
